COMMENT_TX: $B.J. Upton left early trying to steal 3B; while in the rundown, he and shortstop J.J. Hardy collided; 3B umpire Scott Barry called Upton out for running out of the baseline; Upton, 3B coach Ton Foley and manager Joe Maddon all argued the call with Barry, having expected an obstruction call
$while attempting to bunt the first pitch, Johnny Damon suffered a bruise on the tip of his left ring finger when it was struck by the ball
ej,piera001,P,knigb901,Balls and strikes White Sox catcher A. J. Pierzynski ejected by HP umpire Brian Knight between innings for arguing balls and strikes
ej,joycm001,P,hallt901,Called third strike Rays Matt Joyce ejected by HP umpire Tom Hallion for arguing the called third strike as he walked away; he turned back to Hallion instead of walking away
$Kelly Shoppach called for interfering with catcher Hank Conger
Rays pitcher Jeff Niemann left the game due to an injured back

ej,farrj001,M,fairc901,Balls and strikes $Toronto manager John Farrell walked to the plate after making the pitching change and talked to HP umpire Chad Fairchild; after a brief, calm discussion, Fairchild ejected Farrell

ej,maddj801,M,westj901,Changed call at 1B $the throw to first was wide on the foul side of the bag; first baseman Adam Lind swiped at Sam Fuld as he ran past; Fuld was called safe by 1B umpire Joe West; the umpires huddled and then Fuld was called out; 1B coach George Hendrick started talking with West and Rays Manager Joe Maddon ran out to argue; West told Maddon to go back to the dugout a couple of times and then ejected Maddon

ej,uptob001,P,fairc901,Called third strike $B.J. Upton went nuts after being called out for the third time in the game; he was immediately ejected by HP umpire Chad Fairchild; Upton kept yelling and pointing at Fairchild and had to be restrained by two coaches

replay,9,shopk001,TBA,darlg901,STP01,O,N,I,,H $Kelly Shoppach's towering fly ball appeared to hit one of the catwalks at Tropicana Field; Yankees LF Brett Gardner caught the ball on the warning track; Rays manager Joe Maddon talked with crew chief Gary Darling and asked if the ball hit the C-ring catwalk; if it did, the play is a home run by ground rule; Darling watched the replay for 4 minutes and 2 seconds and upheld the call
$originally scored E3, changed to single on 5-29, changed back to E3 on 6-10
Rays first baseman Casey Kotchman left the game due to an injured ankle
Red Sox shortstop Jed Lowrie left the game due to an injured shoulder
Red Sox pitcher Clay Buchholz left the game due to lower back tightness

ej,rodre001,M,barrt901,Allowing run to score from first on fan $the line drive landed on the chalk and bounced into foul territory where it was caught by a fan; interference was called but HP umpire Ted Barrett allowed Evan Longoria to score from 1B; Marlins Manager Edwin Rodriguez came out to ask about why Longoria was allowed to score on what he thought was a  double and dead ball; Barrett told Rodriguez that it was a judgement call by the umpire; when Rodriguez argued the call, he was ejected by Barrett
$after Marlins manager Edwin Rodriguz resigned, the club was run by bench coach Brandon Hyde on an interim basis
$Rays Evan Longoria rounded 2B thinking that Matt Joyce's fly would drop in; he passed Ben Zobrist, who was going back to 2B to tag up; 2B umpire Angel Hernandez immediately called out Longoria

ej,maddj801,M,carav901,Balls and strikes $ball four to Berkman was a very close pitch off the inside part of the plate; Rays pitcher J.P. Howell thought he had a strikeout; Rays Manager Joe Maddon yelled from the dugout asking about the pitch; when he continue to talk, he was ejected by HP umpire Vic Carapazza; Maddon then came out and stepped at the side of the plate where the pitch was and yelled at Carapazza

ej,howej003,P,carav901,Balls and strikes ej,pricd001,P,eddid901,Balls and strikes (From the bench) ej,johne002,P,eddid901,Balls and strikes (From the bench) $Rays pitcher J.P. Howell slammed his glove down on the grass; he picked it up and slapped at the new baseball tossed to him by HP umpire Vic Carapazza; he then took the ball and threw it off the field towards the 1B dugout and asked for a new ball; Carapazza looked at Howell and said something to Howell; Howell, yelling for a new ball, was ejected by Carapazza; Rays pitchers David Price and Elliott Johnson were ejected from the bench by 2B umpire and crew chief Dana DeMuth
$David Ortiz' backswing on a pitch stuck HP umpire Chad Fairchild on the side of the head

$Rays Sean Rodriguez hit a foul ball that struck a lamp on a catwalk in LF; the ball shattered the lamp with pieces falling onto the field and into the seats; there was a delay while the grounds crew picked up the shattered glass; music from 'The Natural' played on the PA
$Rays catcher Jose Lobaton left the game with a sprained left knee; placed on DL
$a 2-2 pitch to Josh Reddick was ruled no swing by 3B umpire Jim Reynolds; the Rays were very unhappy with the call

ej,maddj801,M,fairc901,Balls and strikes $while Rays manager Joe Maddon made the pitching change, he yelled at HP umpire Chad Fairchild and 3B umpire Jim Reynolds about the check swing and the strike zone; after a short time, Maddon was ejected by Fairchild

ej,martd002,C,fairc901,Marco Scutaro bat throwing incident $with the bases loaded and two outs in a scoreless game, Marco Scutaro popped the ball up behind the plate; he was upset with himself and flung the bat down to the artificial turf; the bat bounced weirdly and flew near catcher Kelly Shoppach as he was making the catch; the Rays complained about what they thought was Scutaro throwing the bat at Shoppach; when HP umpire Chad Fairchild refused to listen, bench coach and acting manager Dave Martinez came on the field and was ejected by Fairchild
$the game was delayed for 18 minutes when a bank of lights lost power
originally scored as 3E1, changed on 8-11 to single
$a foul ball by Sean Rodriguez landed in a trash can in the RF picnic area; the can had a cover on it and the ball went in the opening on the side of the cover
originally scored as E5, changed to S5 the next day

replay,7,damoj001,TBA,wintm901,STP01,O,Y,I,,H $Johnny Damon's fly hit the top of the wall on the yellow line and caromed back onto the field; it was ruled a home run (thus a grand slam); Damon stopped at 2B but eventually ran the circuit; Mariners manager Eric Wedge asked crew chief Mike Winters about the call, so Winters watched the replay; after a 2:41 delay, Winters overturned the call to a ball in play, giving Damon a double and allowing all three runners to score; Damon was stranded at 2B
Rays center fielder B. J. Upton left the game due to an injured shoulder
$the ball struck John Lackey's left calf
Red Sox pitcher John Lackey left the game due to a bruised left calf
ej,uptob001,P,hicke901,Call at 2B Rays center fielder B. J. Upton ejected by 2B umpire Ed Hickox

ej,martr004,P,schrp901,Balls and strikes (while catching) $as Johnny Damon stepped into the batter's box, HP umpire Paul Schrieber stepped in front of catcher Russell Martin and said something; when Martin answered, he was ejected by Schreiber
$After pitch hit Kotchman, it deflected into catcher Montero's hand, bruising two fingers. He left game but X-rays showed no breaks.
